text: Sirene was a Norwegian feminist magazine, issued from 1973 to 1983. ==History and profile== Sirene was launched in 1973. One of the founders was Bjørg Vik. The magazine was published by the publishing house J.W. Cappelens Forlag from 1973 to 1976, and thereafter by a dedicated foundation. It had a circulation of 20,000 at its maximum in 1975. In a thesis from 1978 at the University of Oslo, Turid Kleiva described Sirene as a feminist alternative to the traditional weekly magazines. The magazine did not have a dedicated editor, but was produced collectively by a group of editors. The editorial staff included Bjørg Vik, Bitten Modal, Ida Lou Larsen and others. Sirene regular illustrators included Tonje Strøm. The magazine ended publication in 1983. ==References== Category:1973 establishments in Norway Category:1983 disestablishments in Norway Category:Defunct magazines published in Norway Category:Feminism in Norway Category:Feminist magazines Category:Magazines established in 1973 Category:Magazines disestablished in 1983 Category:Magazines published in Oslo Category:Monthly magazines published in Norway Category:Norwegian-language magazines Category:Women's magazines published in Norway
title: Sirene (magazine)
